channel.title: How-To Geek
channel.description: We explain technology. Learn more with our articles, reviews, tips, and the best answers to your most pressing tech questions.

item.title: An Ode to the Optical Microsoft Intellimouse
item.dc:creator: Sydney Butler
item.description: A design that revolutionized comfort and performance, but what made the Intellimouse so special?
item.content:encoded: Like a lot of you, the first optical mouse I ever used was the optical version of the Microsoft Intellimouse. Until I used a ball-less mouse for the first time, I had no idea how annoying that little sphere was to use and maintain. But the iIntellimouse was more than just an average mouse with its ball removed. The overall design was timeless, and I'd even say a mouse that's still usable today.

item.title: Why the 2026 Hyundai Santa Fe Could Be the Best Value Mid-Size SUV Yet
item.dc:creator: Adam Gray
item.description: The 2026 Hyundai Santa Fe is set to redefine mid-size SUVs with its mix of ruggedness, refinement, and value.
item.content:encoded: The mid-size SUV game is brutal. Every brand throws serious money at it, and even the so-called “carryover” years usually sneak in a few surprises.

item.title: 3 Terminal Tricks You'll Wish You Knew Earlier
item.dc:creator: Graeme Peacock
item.description: Or slog it out with the keyboard for the rest of your life.
item.content:encoded: It doesn't matter whether you're learning the terminal or a seasoned pro, there's always plenty of little tricks for you to learn—tricks that save you time. I have three useful Bash tricks that you can add to your arsenal.

item.title: I Tested This Open Source Keyboard for a Month, and It Replaced Gboard
item.dc:creator: Faisal Rasool
item.description: It's 100% offline and supports glide typing.
item.content:encoded: There’s absolutely no reason a phone’s keyboard app needs to connect to the internet, yet every popular keyboard app does this. Google’s Gboard and Microsoft’s Swiftkey both ping home, which feels like a privacy nightmare. The problem is that I’ve never been able to find a keyboard that’s just as good as Gboard—until now.

item.title: The Smoothest Way to Send Clipboard Text and Files Between Your Android and PC
item.dc:creator: Faisal Rasool
item.description: No need to email yourself files and text yourself clipboard data.
item.content:encoded: It’s absurd that in the year 2025, there isn’t a quick and universal platform-independent way to send text and files between a phone and a computer. You always have to rely on some mix of texting apps, email, or cloud storage to share files and text across platforms. Or so I thought.

item.title: macOS 26 Spotlight Is Good, but It Can't Replace My Favorite Launcher
item.dc:creator: Patrick Campanale
item.description: Where Spotlight falls short, Alfred steps up to the plate.
item.content:encoded: Did macOS 26’s Spotlight update leave you wanting more? It did for me, too. That’s why I’m still using Alfred. Alfred is so much more than a Spotlight replacement, and isn’t even on the same playing field as Apple’s search tool.

item.title: I Replaced Notepad++ on Linux With This Text Editor
item.dc:creator: Zunaid Ali
item.content:encoded: One of the most missed software when switching to Linux is Notepad++. Many Windows users love it due to its simplicity and programming-related features. There are many modern text editors on Linux that do a great job. After some searching, I've found one that I like a lot.

item.title: Toyota Land Cruiser or 4Runner: The Ultimate Off-Road Showdown
item.dc:creator: Tyler Dupont
item.description: Land Cruiser and 4Runner go head-to-head to crown Toyota’s true off-road champion.
item.content:encoded: Toyota’s reputation for building rugged, go-anywhere vehicles is legendary, and few nameplates embody that legacy better than the Land Cruiser and the 4Runner. Both have decades of proven durability, serious off-road hardware, and loyal followings, making this matchup a true test of capability and value.

item.title: Every iOS 26 Feature Apple "Borrowed" From Android
item.dc:creator: Shikhar Mehrotra
item.description: iOS 26 has a lot of new features, but not all of them are entirely new.
item.content:encoded: Apple’s calling iOS 26 the biggest update for iPhones in a while, and it does have a lot of new features to show for. However, if you look closely, you'll realize that many of the new tricks are oddly familiar because Android phones have had them for quite some time.

item.title: You Can Turn Almost Any Philips Hue Bulbs Into Motion Sensors, but There's a Catch
item.dc:creator: Adam Davidson
item.description: Your smart bulbs can now be even smarter, under the right circumstances.
item.content:encoded: We may not be able to see them, but our homes are awash with radio signals as our smart devices communicate with each other over networks such as Wi-Fi and Zigbee. We pass through these radio signals all the time, and Philips Hue has come up with a neat way to use these signals to turn the vast majority of Philips Hue bulbs into motion sensors.
